item.title: Anthropic’s crawler is ignoring websites’ anti-AI scraping policies
item.description:
The ClaudeBot web crawler that Anthropic uses to scrape training data for AI models like Claude has hammered iFixit’s website almost a million times in a 24-hour period, seemingly violating the repair company’s Terms of Use in the process.

“If any of those requests accessed our terms of service, they would have told you that use of our content expressly forbidden. But don’t ask me, ask Claude!” said iFixit CEO Kyle Wiens on X, posting images that show Anthropic’s chatbot acknowledging that iFixit’s content was off limits. “You’re not only taking our content without paying, you’re tying up our devops resources. If you want to have a conversation about licensing our content for commercial use, we’re right here.”

Hey @AnthropicAI: I get...

Continue reading…

item.title: CrowdStrike vouchers for workers after global IT outage flagged as possible fraud
item.description:
UberEats $10 gift cards blocked as ‘high usage’ triggers transport firm’s security alert

An attempt by the cyber security firm CrowdStrike to thank workers who tackled the recent global IT outage with a $10 UberEats voucher hit a stumbling block after Uber flagged the gesture as potential fraud.

CrowdStrike confirmed it sent the $10 voucher to “teammates and partners” who helped customers affected by a faulty software update issued by the company. The failure paralysed 8.5m devices around the world and led to chaos at airports, hospital appointment cancellations and TV channel blackouts.

Continue reading...

item.title: The Microsoft Surface Laptop Go 3 just dropped in price by an additional $50
item.description: As of July 25, get the Microsoft Surface Laptop Go 3 for $50 lower than its July 24 price. It's now $549.99 at Amazon.

item.title: Get the Asus ZenScreen portable monitor for 24% off and make your work setup travel-friendly
item.description: The Asus ZenScreen 15.6-inch 1080P portable monitor is just $159 at Amazon, down from the normal price of $209. That's a 24% discount.
